London: "I've seen bigger."

@marshalederman @CBC From this moment forward, all my hiking photography will be captured whilst wearing tapered military trousers.

@ladurantaye @MontePaulsen @NeilCBC Really only inconvenient for those peddling islamophobia.
Guess we've reached that part in the movie where we all watch our televisions in disbelief?
Hey, @SuzyPatrick: any way we can organize tea cupboard so tea doesn't collapse on me like caffeinated Jenga every time I open door?
Stay tuned for Dick's new travel show: White Hoods. https://t.co/Cij2R8mxi0
I love when people talk "types" of terrorism, like it's some kind of grape variety. How do you like your hate? Room temperature or chilled?
Guessing it wasn't a Syrian refugee who shot up that mosque in Quebec.
I'm too lazy to cut this down. https://t.co/bpiDzY9Pbm
For sure @realDonaldTrump will hate everyone knowing he's afraid of stairs so, whatever you do, don't tell anyone.
I finally installed my son's @MonkeyLectric's on his bike and shot a long exposure of him riding Vancouver's seawal… https://t.co/oP95dbu4Fi
Was going to fly out of Seattle to India, but now direct out of Vancouver. Avoiding U.S. for foreseeable future.
I really thought I would hate La La Land. But I thought it was terrific.

I thought Trump's executive order to strip the Jamaican 4x100 relay team's 2008 Olympic gold medal was a bit much.

@chrisgailus LOL - yes! I'd forgotten how wonderful it is to just stare at a baby sleeping. Bliss!

Most if not all world problems can be linked to people who stand-still on subway escalators.
Neighbor is spending $14-billion on a wall. What an idiot.
Guess college kids are paying for the wall. #tequila

Leader of the fact-free world.
@weeddude There's a tracked-package joke in there somewhere.

The roads on YVR's westside are crumbling. Potholes everywhere. Along Spanish Banks? Brutal! Dangerous for cyclists, tires etc. - SAD!

Told my daughter women were marching today and she raised her fist in solidarity.*
*It's possible she's just pooin… https://t.co/qllj2usAiJ
It's a good day for toilet humour. https://t.co/P35J3pS87e
He fixed climate change on his first day! HERO. | All References to Climate Change Deleted From White House Website https://t.co/xUPIbFAhiC
Black Mirror is fucking stressful.
Tomorrow marks 20 years since Grant Hadwin cut down the Golden Spruce on Haida Gwaii.
@MKieltyka A poo and pee pun in one sentence! Well done! And thanks for sharing!
@buzzbishop Not that I need help with the symbolism. But apparently many people do.
@buzzbishop Wow - that is powerful.
@ianhinkle I'm super excited to shoot it. I missed it last year by hours in Varanasi. But now I'm going to Vrindavan/Mathura, its epicenter.

Finally @JerrySeinfeld gets his break. | Seinfeld teams with Netflix for stand-up specials, more...
https://t.co/VkYd3PbuF0 via @thr
@weeddude @BuzzFeedNews Only if the daily brain-storming session is called Rusch Hour.

What's got two thumbs, is going back to India in March and will be doing a travel feature while there for the Globe & Mail?
Hint: it's me.

@arielhelwani Yair is fun to watch - but that wasn't.
Lyric of the night by Majical Cloudz: “One thing I'll do, if it ever goes wrong/ I'll write you into one of my songs..."
The last thing you'll see in Vancouver is a driver waving at you just before he runs you over. We are polite to the end.
No ropes. | The North Face: Alex Honnold - El Sendero Luminoso https://t.co/IODnEkc38Y v
Wreck Beach, British Columbia [01.14.16] https://t.co/PK4Kec7HGI
@Bricoleur @sophielui Dont't worry, when we win we will buy you a sense of humour. But it's coming out of my kid's cut.
@sophielui He likes Set for Life. We're going to split it.
I'm reading John le Carre's memoir The Pigeon Tunnel and it's really informative. For example, I've realized my life is dull.

"I'm not too young to gamble - I'm too young to collect the money when I win."
- London Rhys McRanor, 8.5 years old.
Applaud snowboarder's use of inflatable backpack in avalanche. I use orange arm floaties and hope for the best.
@brennanleffler @CTVW5 A wee nippy out today...
On the menu: Penne pasta with chorizo and a dash of frustration https://t.co/1M4KH6bzFr via @vancouvermetro
When next week's column is already done. https://t.co/CHamN5HiIa
Slowly going broke booking camping sites for summer.
I wish staring at a baby was a workout.

About 250 Facebook shares of my handful of Big Squeeze stories over past month or so. More to come...
https://t.co/unc41S4HTO
Here's a story on getting my son ready for school in the morning. Think of it as a presidential digestif. https://t.co/2IGXFW6El1
The man can speak.
@KillerMoleMom Good for her! Well done!
@KillerMoleMom He's excited. I think he was expecting another eight year old though.
@KillerMoleMom Yes! I managed to get off Twitter for a few minutes to make a baby with @SuzyPatrick. LOL. How are you?
Enjoying Netflix's London Spy. Really good.
@KillerMoleMom It would be weirder if you all woke up in different cities and had no idea how you got there.
@rebeccacoleman All good. Took a couple days off at birth. Getting some sleep. @SuzyPatrick on baby duty; I'm on London duty. :)
Blue Monday is next week. In Canada, it's the day everybody's @TimHortons Xmas gift cards run out.
@rebeccacoleman Congrats! You have a book. Woot!
